-They said they are unable to give refunds via Paypal now, and I see on other sites that people are claiming Paypal ceased doing business with them even though Dorkside is claiming they "are no longer doing business with Paypal". threads.name: Morphine-Kun
threads.com:
Welcome back everyone, hope you're all doing well.

The time has come for us to finally have new releases in the line! By now most of everyone who ordered Olivier and Vania should have them in hand. Its seems the delay was worth it as Olivier seems to be one of the better releases in the line. Vania also seems to be a generally good release as people are having fun messing with her and Olivier. As of now, we only have one other figure up for Pre-Order right now, that being Bikini Clover. Currently we know that the Polynian and Touhou series will continue since Marisa is supposedly the next in line to go up. The official Poly 4Koma is still going and it seems its been well received as it gives little look into the everyday lives of the Polys we know. We also had a wonderful surprise in the form of the new Polynian MLL body! We finally have a counterpart to the Iana body. Aside from that things have been pretty quiet for the time being.

As always, here is the assistance e-mail for those who need it, so if any problem should arise, feel free to contact them over at "user_support@mile-stone.jp" or the shop you purchased the figure from.

Once again, feel free to share your photos and adventures, they add life and some fun to the thread. Also, welcome newcomers, we hope you enjoy your stay.

last_replies.name: Anonymous
last_replies.com:
>>10158183
Alright, I’ll entertain the idea that this isn’t a troll post and you are serious.

Anon, you could POSSIBLY commission a 3D artist with basic measurements to make a printable 3D model, then print it with a resin printer with the model set to 1/12 scale. The first major hurdle is getting an artist to seriously take on such a commission. The next challenge is the likely cost. Unless the artist has no scruples they’ll likely charge a pretty penny to do something most will flat-out say no to. The next step is getting it printed. If you have a printer then you’re good, otherwise you’ll either need to buy one, borrow one, or outsource one from an online service like Shapeways.

The real issue here is at 1/12 scale there’s a lot of detail that won’t make it in even a professionally hand-sculpted form due to size and material properties. Unless your dick has a unique shape or has body-modifications like piercings or whatever there won’t be too much difference between a 1/12 scale version of your own dick and a generic dick casted from an existing figure or that’s been custom sculpted.

last_replies.name: Anonymous
last_replies.com:
>>10158183
1. Buy a 3d scanner, scan it and touch it up in blender. Scale down and print with a resin printer (moderate expense, moderate skill)
2. Painstakingly 3d model it entirely from scratch (cheap, very difficult)
3. Take plenty of reference pictures and hope that >>10158291 works (very expensive, relatively easy)
4. Make a plaster casting. Make a copy using the mold. cast that copy in shrinking silicone. Repeat several times until it's 1/12 scale. (Expensive, very difficult)

last_replies.name: Anonymous
last_replies.com:
>>10158158
You could either make a silicone mold and cast with rubber/flexible resin or use a resin 3d printer which let's you use flexible UV resin. A printer is much more expensive upfront but is much more useful long term while mold making is cheaper to start but becomes more expensive and screwing up molds/casts can be costly.
>I have an elegoo mars 3 and it's amazing being able to print a shitload of action figure accessories/miniatures, garage kits and coomer parts on command.

Read the manga, the anime adaption has f issues: it diverged from the manga's plot and never adapted the final arc, and even for the content it did adapt, it never had good art or animation 1 specific episode aside, and it had a lot of filler, which exacerbates the slower pacing of the early villain of the week material before it switched to an arc based format, got more tactical fights, etc.

Once that shift does happen, though, the manga goes from good to fantastic and never, ever stops improving (and does improve more gradually across that early content), vs a lot of other shonen which start strong but get issues the further in you get

Read it on Mangadex: this has both the NULL and the A-Destiny scans (Null has more natural sounding wording but occasional mistranslations, A-destiny avoids those mistranslations but has stiffer wording and is only v18 onwards), and also has all the behind the scenes, gash cafe, and gaiden bonus chapters a lot of other sites exclude. (there is a new release of the manga using the new digital kazenban rips some people I know are working on, but it's not gonna be done for a while, so not an option yet sadly)

I also have a WIP guide with translation fixes, extra color pages from the kazenbans, links to specific moments the anime DOES adapt well, and videos that sync up the manga to the anime music, you can find links to that here: https://desuarchive.org/a/thread/227531145/#227534560 , if you hit v22 and want the rest of what I already have done (even if it's not on the guide, I have links to a bunch of sync vids, the kazenban color pages, and other translation stuff already for stuff past that) you can email/DM with the info in that link

If you DO insist on watching the anime, you need to switch to manga chapter 212 once you finish episode 138, that's when the plot divergence happens.

last_replies.name: Anonymous
last_replies.com:
>>10150848
Because I like them you fucking retard. Why do you collect toys?

last_replies.name: Anonymous
last_replies.com:
>>10150834
I'd feel lucky if there were one thing I could convince myself to enjoy

last_replies.name: Anonymous
last_replies.com:
I started selling my shit because I don't have the space and anytime I move it's a huge mess. I decided to only keep one character of my all time favorite franchises in 1/12 scale. For other shit I like I try to find 1/18 scale figures so that they can be in a display here it makes sense that they're all in a crowd.
In general I bought one bookshelf and \I don't ever want to expand, if I can't keep it in my bookshelf it's too much and I decide what I want and don't want.

It's difficult since like it or not you do form an attachment to plastic and it's hard to get rid of it. Especially when you are selling at a loss and you like it more than what little money they give you, but you gotta stop being a hoarder and sell it. While it sucks the peace of mind of not having tons of figures is very freeing. I don't usually regret selling stuff, it's only been a few that I regret but that's ok, they can always be rebought if I really want them.
Hoarding is not cool /toy/bros, wish I had had more restraint when I was younger.

last_replies.name: Anonymous
last_replies.com:
Your collection needs to be a reflection of your own life. For example, thanks to Ghostbusters Afterlife my little brother now obsesses with all GB, they even got him a Playmobil GB2 ecto with the dark overalls and pink slime.

I never liked GB (I still think Real GB is shit) but I gave the og movie a try and I loved it. Then I saw a Netflix documentary of how they made the movie and started obsessing over something I never gave a shit about. Everything comes down to me wanting to buy a Playmobil ecto from the first movie with the 4 gb in kaki overalls.

>Dopamine rush ends and realization kicks in

This is not me, I love GB now but I just can't spent my autism and money on every little thing that gets my attention. I had to do some self reflection and decide: what is the most important thing about Ghostbusters for me as a whole? Oh yeah, my little brother. So I ditch everything Ive planned and now I just want to kitbash a little Playmobil version of him that looks like this:

>Venkman hairpiece bc my brother has that bowl cut the fig has
>Spengler suit bc he says he's egon
>Real Ghostbusters proton pack and blaster bc those are blue and he owns a Hasbro proton pack and blaster which are blue

TL;DR: Ignore all upcoming products and focus on what you currently have, evaluate that stuff, RANK YOUR COLLECTION AND MAKE A HIERARCHY OF COOLEST>>>>SHITTIEST PRODUCT, choose what is important to you, don't listen to mass corporations telling you you gotta catch em all. Start with your biggest treasure, you holy grail, your childhood buddy, your turboman/Emmet/woody whatever is the absolute trophy of your collection, rank it as #1 and then think:

>Hum, if I were forced to lose this toy forever and never replace it, what else in my collection shall become #1

The answer will lead you to find the #2 toy of your collection, do it again and again and again until every single microplastic particle in your lungs has been ranked. Then the shitty toys need to go.

I'm the guy that wanted to design a proper nerf minigun. The good news is that the design is pretty much done in my head, the bad news is that I barely have the time to model it in CAD. I also need some info from those knowledgeable on blaster modding: is there any off-the-shelf tube that can be used as a functional barrel and not just as a cosmetic piece? I was thinking about PTFE for the low friction coefficient, but I have yet to check if I can source one with the proper inner diameter. Also, I'm using the piston of the Strongarm as a reference for the propulsion system because that's what I have (and the design of the plunger should make things a little easier to design). Feel free to suggest any other piston system (but remember that a minigun takes six of them so keep cost in mind) as long as you can provide some functional interface dimensions, like in pic related.
Speaking of Strongarm, I love it but racking the slide and pulling the trigger feels like they're full of sand: is there anything that can be done to make them smoother?

>>10151198
Freelancing is just making shit up as you go. Basically its like "well i like this railroad, and I like this area, but my railroad never ran through there, but im gonna model it that way" or "the railroad im modeling never actually had this engine, but I like this engine, so im gonna run it anyways." Its pretty fun. I dont have room for a layout, but when i do mine will be a freelanced Western Maryland railway. My railroad is going to be "what if the WM survived the mega mergers and remained independent into the 21st century?" So ill have ES44s and SD90s painted in WM colors pulling modern equipment. But ill also be able to buy SD40s and GPs in WM colors, and I can imagine that the WM had a steam program, so i can run WM steam engines too

What the fuck is going on with this company? Definitely a horrible first time experience with them.

last_replies.name: Anonymous
last_replies.com:
>>10155279
Premium DNA is a company formed by the same people that owned and operated Megalopolis Toys. They ended up scamming a ton of people, went under, and even got sued by Entertainment Earth (google it). They were using funds from preorders people placed on their Megalopolis retail site to fund their Premium DNA side company and fucked over everyone who ordered from the other site. People that didn't get fucked over forgave them because they wanted Premium DNA product and then act surprised when they get fucked over by these same scam artists.

last_replies.name: Anonymous
last_replies.com:
>>10155279
Megalopolis was an online toy store that was heavily shilled for about a year across YouTube by various different "influencers." Shortly after obtaining a proper foothold, and getting some good word of mouth, they began promoting toys that would be exclusive to their store, under the Premium DNA brand. This included some big licenses, like Madballs.

Around July of 2020 people began to notice that they were getting charged for orders, but they weren't shipping (much like BBTS, you were not supposed to get charged until the item was about to ship). At first it seemed like some scamdemic problems, so people were understanding... but they kept doing it, and they wouldn't ship. This went on for months. I personally had my Great Ape Vegeta Figuarts figure through them, which is a reasonably expensive figure ($200~ish). They charged me, and then a month later I contacted them because it hadn't shipped. At first they were responsive, but after about three months they stopped responding to emails, and at that point I backcharged them after googling the issue and finding out that this was widespread. Word was that they were taking payments for figures that they never even ordered from the distributors, and apparently behind the scenes they ran up huge debts with said distributors, which they never paid. All of this eventually came to a head, and they shut down.

But Premium DNA came back, and claimed no actual connection to Megalopolis. They just said that they had a partnership, and since Megalopolis was gone, that was over. However people have done a deep dive on them, and found that it's all the same people who ran Megalopolis, which makes sense, because it was literally promoted as the Megalopolis house brand: https://creationedge.medium.com/the-story-of-toy-overlord-inc-f6e2e041c14a

Look, here is a press release from them: https://news.toyark.com/2020/07/23/megalopolis-announces-battletoads-clay-fighter-and-earthworm-jim-and-more-retro-action-figures-396294

I'm so glad I started collecting mid 80s to late 90s Castle and Space sets when I did. I started around 2016 and had some extra money from a side thing and they were on the threshold of becoming too overpriced. I managed to get every set I had as a kid from that era and then some; I think I've got like 90% of all Castle and Space sets made between 1985 and 1997.

These days I would not be able to do that; the price on these things doubled/tripled in the last few years, it's fucking insane. The only big one that I missed out on is the Dark Forest Fortress (6079) - Fortunately I had the Hemlock Stronghold in pretty much perfect condition from my teen years, when I built it once and it kept it on display briefly before disassembling it. I have the baseplate and a handful of pieces for it so far, but a long way to go, and those figures are going to be expensive so I might just have to be content with only having one set from Hemlock Stronghold...

threads.name: Anonymous
threads.com:
We had a really comfy LOTR toys thread here a while ago. As said before, the original line from 2001-2005 still holds up really well, especially some of the later figures when Toybiz started moving away from action gimmicks to 30POA (they're essentially Marvel Legends style figures), and they're actually still quite affordable to collect, with a few exceptions (the Balrog).

There's not really a lot of new stuff to talk about with LOTR toys although Diamond Select did just come out with their 8" deluxe figures. There's no toys for "that show" and there probably won't be (good riddance). Once in a while it's nice to have a thread to catch up on how fellow LOTR anons' collections are going though. What scenes do you want to recreate? Are you army building? Doing any customs and conversions to complete your collection? Have you come across any cool boomer LOTR merch from before the movies? Let's take a moment to celebrate that this beloved book series got the action figure line it deserved.

threads.name: Anonymous
threads.com:
Dumb stuff you did with your toys when you were little?

When I was like 8 I got the four good guys and one of the bad guys as a present, I wasn't into the line, and I found the actual characters boring, but the little dudes that came with them, for some reason I liked their designs better so I played with them more.

I imagined they were super heroes. The yellow one with the visor above his head I imagined was team leader. He had Superman's power set, except he could shoot various kinds of lasers, not just heat. The orange one I imagined having Wolverine's powerset, but also a set of robotic, mecha powers. The blue one I imagined having a full suite of psychic powers and super human intelligence. The green one, largely because of his pose, I imagined had super speed and various speed related powers, like flight and invulnerability. From the villains, I had the fourth one, the little light purple bug. I imagined he could teleport, shapeshift and had stretching powers, and he was a wild card element that sometimes worked with the others and sometimes against them.

threads.name: Anonymous
threads.com: Bought the mindstorms robot inventor set because I heard they were discontinuing mindstorms and I've always wanted to toy around with it. Is it as bad as they say or is it a good place to start?

last_replies.name: Anonymous
last_replies.com:
>>10139050
It has sensors and a "brain" to where you can custom upload programs

last_replies.name: Anonymous
last_replies.com:
>>10138805
to list a few:

1) No one-brain-brick gui, only a bunch of LEDs, even the original RCX had a way to select programs.

2) Teal can be hard to integrate with existing collections to make something that looks cohesive.

3) Has 6 ports instead of 7 like the previous version, and while the RCX only had 3 ports, you could stack motors on a single port.

4) Worse specs, it runs at 100mhz, with room for 30 programs and 32mb of storage, while the previous version was 300mhz (and could be overclocked to 400mhz) and had an SD card slot.

5) cables are permanently connected to the motors and sensors, meaning if any part of that cable gets damaged you have to replace the entire thing.

6) No backwards compatability, Ev3 could use NXT motors (but not sensors), and there were first and third party adapters adapters for RCX motors, and the new one is incapable of using any of these.

7) A somewhat more minor issues, but it comes with a 4th motor instead of a touch sensor, severely limiting capabilities out of the box.


All in all, it's pretty crap.

last_replies.name: Anonymous
last_replies.com:
>>10138805
No LCD screen was a deal breaker for me. The previously one has so much charm. This one is based on Boost, I think that they only changed the colors to teal.

They added support for daisy chain, and has a lot of QoL. But it lacks the charm of the other one. You could even run Linux in the previously Intelligent Brick.

The motors on 51515 and other stuff all superior though. They really should've gone for an "industrial" color design, like black and yellow, black and red or something like that.

The programming support is pretty good though. The main problem was the Intelligent Brick and the colors.

There's also the problem that you can't make your own cables or replace them without disassemble the whole thing and repair it. It's also incompatible with the previously stuff.
